intro: Triumfetta pilosa f. tricuspidata, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are typically covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in summer. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. This species is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various growing conditions.
